message: Tonight at Code Club we measured magnetic fields with the BBC Micro BIT and Our Scratch coders were wondering how to simulate the effect of gravity on their characters.

Code Club Saturday at Curborough Community Centre 
13:30 Start.

Age 8 upwards. If you are older than 14 you are most welcome, however we would like to see you assisting our younger members if you are able.

data.description: Kitronic Line Following Robot for BBC Micro BIT. Using a motor controller board and digital I/O for the line following sensors. Programmed in the MicroBIT editor using the Kitronic Extension libraries.
This 80g Drone takes 5MP pictures and 720 HD Video and can be programmed with Scratch.

data.title: Photos from Curborough Community Centre Code Club's post

message: Tonight at Code Club we used the MicroBIT Code editor to control a Kitronic Line Following Robot. Weather permitting, at the next Curborough meeting we will program the Tello Micro Drone using Scratch!!

data.title: Photos from Curborough Community Centre Code Club's post

message: Thank you to Tim, Bill and Sean for these amazing 3D Printed MicroBIT Stands. Each one took an hour to print! :-)

data.title: Lichfield Library and Curborough Community Centre Code Club

message: Our next Saturday Code Club at Curborough Community Centre will be June 29th at 13:30. Please let us know if you wish to attend.

data.title: Photos from RAF Cosford Air Show (Official)'s post

message: We are all set to appear at RAF Cosford Airshow on June 9th. Please buy a Ticket and come see us. Children under 16 Free with a paying adult.

data.description: Including Scratch 3.0, here are a few ways to interact with the micro:bit in scratch.
data.title: Connecting the micro:bit to Scratch : Support

message:
If you wish to use a BBC Micro BIT with Scratch 3 please look at the following link which explains it all.
https://support.microbit.org/support/solutions/articles/19000026080-using-the-micro-bit-with-scratch

I would just like to thank everyone who has helped with both the Lichfield Library sessions and more recently the session we ran at Curborough Community Centre. I would in future, like to mention you all by name as the site seems a bit anonymous at the moment. We do respect our members privacy and always ask before posting pictures of the children involved in the club. My thanks go to the Library Staff, our new STEM Ambassadors, the parents who stay and assist including Ania, who secured our sessions at Curborough Community Centre.
One of our regulars managed to get the BBC Micro Bit working with his own Scratch 3 game! Very Well done.

data.title: Photos from Curborough Community Centre Code Club's post

message: Great session Tuesday evening. We Welcomed a new young coder who used MicroBit for the first time and did some pretty impressive stuff with the motion sensor.

data.title: Photos from Curborough Community Centre Code Club's post

message: This Saturday we were at Curborough Community Centre. A big thank you to our volunteers and young computer coders for making it a successful afternoon. Will post date of next meet soon and hope to see some new faces. Our Tuesday sessions at Lichfield Library continue, so please drop in and see us.

Saturday 11th May 1:30pm
Code Club at
Curborough Community Centre
All welcome 😊
WS13 7NY
There will be no Code Club on 16th or 23rd. Have a Happy Easter.
At tonights Code Club, we are going to get our BBC MicroBits to sing!

data.title: Photos from Curborough Community Centre Code Club's post

message: If you are lucky enough to come across an old BBC Micro, be careful when turning it on after 30 years! Thankfully You Tube is full of videos of people finding out why and with a cheap fix from EBAY. I will bring this along to code club once it is fixed 😊😊😊

Hi everyone. Sorry, the traffic has defeated my attempts to get to Lichfield yet again. Trust you are all coding some interesting stuff. If you have any programming questions, please get your parents to message me or post a comment here. Happy Coding, Stewart. 😊

data.description: The BBC Micro:bit is a great project board for anyone who wants to ease into programming. Here are several beginner projects you can build with a BBC Micro:bit.
data.title: 10 Awesome Beginner Projects for the BBC Micro:bit Board

message: Hi everyone, please check out this link for the BBC Micro BIT.   https://www.makeuseof.com/tag/bbc-microbit-beginner-projects/

data.description: I doubt I will make it tonight. Apologies in advance. 😕

message: I doubt I will make it tonight. Apologies in advance. 😕

Hello everyone.
There will be no Code Club next week. See you all on Tuesday 26th February. Thank you for your continued support.

data.description: Scratch is a free programming language and online community where you can create your own interactive stories, games, and animations.
data.title: Scratch - Imagine, Program, Share

message:
This week in our Tuesday Code Club session we saw a BBC Micro Bit interacting with Scratch 3. Follow the link below to see how to connect your Micro Bit to Scratch.

If you have an Apple Mac or Mac Book, Bluetooth is built in. If you are using a PC, you might need to purchase a Bluetooth USB Dongle.

I will be demonstrating this at our Saturday Code Club, this coming Saturday 2nd February.

https://scratch.mit.edu/microbit

data.description: The ultimate Maker store — a curated range of the best of breed Maker products. Worldwide delivery. Personal support. FREE UK Shipping for orders over £50.
data.title: The best for Raspberry Pi, micro:bit, and Arduino – Pimoroni

message:
Hi everyone. We had our first session at St Marys tonight. Thank you all for attending. Apologies for being a little late, the traffic from Stoke was appalling. We had a few issues with computers tonight and with the new Scratch 3 site. Other clubs have had issues with the new Scratch also, so hopefully they will be fixed soon.

It was nice to see some of you coding with the BBC Micro Bits and some of you have been lucky enough to get them as gifts for Christmas.   

Some of you asked where the BBC Micro Bits can be purchased. Try the following store: https://shop.pimoroni.com/  Also https://cpc.Farnell.com and https://www.rapidonline.com

data.description: FREE WORLDWIDE SHIPPING!The first ever Code Club book is here! With it, you'll learn how to code using Scratch, the block-based programming language. In each chapter you’ll find instructions to build cool games, animations, and interactive stories. Your friendly robot guide will aid you step-by-st...
data.title: Code Club Book of Scratch - Volume 1

message:
Hi Everyone. Take a look at the new Code Club Book of Scratch. The hardback is £9.99 and the PDF version is a free download. :-)

https://store.rpipress.cc/products/code-club-book-of-scratch-volume-1

Our first Saturday session will be 2nd Feb 1pm - 3pm

Will have Raspberry Pi, BBC Micro Bit, Arduino, VEX Robot as usual.
